info.name: Conversations - Conversations API Collection
info.description: Query and interact with existing Conversation threads, messages, and channels

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.
The maximum number of results to display per page.
Whether to return only results that have been archived. Default is false.

You can specify an association type here of `TICKET`. If this is set the response will included a thread associations object and associated ticket id if present. If there are no associations to a ticket with this conversation, then the thread associations object will not be present on the response.

request.description: Archives a single thread. The thread will be permanently deleted 30 days after placed in an archived state.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: Whether the thread to update is archived. Default is false. A thread's status property can not be updated if the thread is archived.

request.description: Updates a single thread. Either a thread's status can be updated, or the thread can be restored.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

query.description: Whether the thread to update is archived. Default is false. A thread's status property can not be updated if the thread is archived.

query.description: Whether the thread to update is archived. Default is false. A thread's status property can not be updated if the thread is archived.

item.name: Get the original content of a single message.

request.description: Returns the complete original text and rich text bodies of a message. This will be different from the text and rich text in the message itself if the message's `truncationStatus` is anything other than `NOT_TRUNCATED`.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Get message history for a thread.

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.
The maximum number of results to display per page.

Set the sort order of the response. Valid options are `id` (default) and `latestMessageTimestamp` (which requires the `latestMessageTimestampAfter` field to also be set). If youre filtering threads by `associatedContactId` , you can sort in descending order by prepending - to the sort option (e.g., `-id` or `-latestMessageTimestampAfter` ). Otherwise, results are always returned in ascending order.

Set the sort order of the response. Valid options are `id` (default) and `latestMessageTimestamp` (which requires the `latestMessageTimestampAfter` field to also be set). If youre filtering threads by `associatedContactId` , you can sort in descending order by prepending - to the sort option (e.g., `-id` or `-latestMessageTimestampAfter` ). Otherwise, results are always returned in ascending order.
The ID of the conversations inbox you can optionally include to retrieve the associated messages for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `associatedContactId` property.
The ID of the conversations inbox you can optionally include to retrieve the associated messages for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `associatedContactId` property.
The ID of a contact you can optionally include to retrieve a filtered list of conversations for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `inboxId` property.
The status of the associated conversations to filter by (either `OPEN` or `CLOSED`). This property must be provided if youre including the `associatedContactId` query parameter.
The minimum `latestMessageTimestamp`. This is required only when sorting by `latestMessageTimestamp`.
Whether to return only results that have been archived.

You can specify an association type here of `TICKET`. If this is set the response will included a thread associations object and associated ticket id if present. If there are no associations to a ticket with this conversation, then the thread associations object will not be present on the response.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.
The maximum number of results to display per page.

Set the sort order of the response. Valid options are `id` (default) and `latestMessageTimestamp` (which requires the `latestMessageTimestampAfter` field to also be set). If youre filtering threads by `associatedContactId` , you can sort in descending order by prepending - to the sort option (e.g., `-id` or `-latestMessageTimestampAfter` ). Otherwise, results are always returned in ascending order.
The ID of the conversations inbox you can optionally include to retrieve the associated messages for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `associatedContactId` property.
The ID of a contact you can optionally include to retrieve a filtered list of conversations for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `inboxId` property.
The status of the associated conversations to filter by (either `OPEN` or `CLOSED`). This property must be provided if youre including the `associatedContactId` query parameter.
The minimum `latestMessageTimestamp`. This is required only when sorting by `latestMessageTimestamp`.
Whether to return only results that have been archived.
